scenarioDescription:
The OGLE-2018-BLG-1185L Exoplanetary System


Overview

OGLE-2018-BLG-1185L is a star with 0.37 times the mass of the Sun, and NaN times its radius. It is located 24135.54 light years away from the solar system.

OGLE-2018-BLG-1185L is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the OGLE-2018-BLG-1185L system


OGLE-2018-BLG-1185L b

OGLE-2018-BLG-1185L b was discovered by the OGLE observatory, in 2021-08, using the microlensing method. Its semi-major axis is 1.54 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of OGLE-2018-BLG-1185L b is 8.405 times the mass of Earth. The radius of OGLE-2018-BLG-1185L b is 2.830 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, OGLE-2018-BLG-1185L b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system OGLE-2018-BLG-1185L, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the OGLE.
name: OGLE-2018-BLG-1185L - System With 1 Exoplanet
